title: Front Sprocket - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Caution - Do not spill brake fluid
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork. Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
Position the motorcycle on the side stand.
Remove the right hand side panel (see
Remove the lock nuts and detach the coolant expansion tank from its mounting. Discard the lock nuts.
Remove the fixings, detach the alternator harness and remove the coolant expansion tank mounting.
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork. Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
Remove and discard the fixing and detach the rear brake fluid reservoir from the relay bracket.
Note the routing of the brake switch harness for installation.
Bend back the front sprocket lock washer.
Have an assistant sit on the motorcycle, select sixth gear and apply the front brake hard.

body.name: Fit new lock washer front sprocket abni_2

body.body: Remove the front sprocket nut and discard the lock washer.
Set the drive chain adjustment to allow maximum free play in the drive chain.
Note the orientation of the front sprocket for installation.
Disengage the front sprocket from the drive chain and slide it off the output shaft.

metadata.products: D34; DD4; DG4; DF4; DD2; DF2; DF; DE; DE2

A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.

To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork. Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
Remove and discard the fixing and detach the rear brake fluid reservoir from the relay bracket.

Remove the front sprocket nut and discard the lock washer.
Set the drive chain adjustment to allow maximum free play in the drive chain.
Note the orientation of the front sprocket for installation.
Disengage the front sprocket from the drive chain and slide it off the output shaft.
